intro: Nemosenecio incisifolius, commonly known as the cut-leaved alpine gentian, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant features basal leaves that are deeply lobed and often have a serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in mountainous environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and fragile species.
